persona.name: Anna Phillips
persona.personality: Inquisitive and enthusiastic about her field, she conveys a sense of wonder and humor in her discussions about leeches and their biology.
persona.employment: Curator of Parasitic Worms at the Smithsonian's National Museum of Natural History
persona.notes: Recently led a team that discovered a new species of medicinal leech in North America, marking the first such discovery in 40 years.
persona.communication_style: Conversational and engaging, often using humor to make complex biological concepts more relatable.
